name: The Quiz You Can Ace | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these Jedi from the "Star Wars" movies carried a purple lightsaber?
questions.explanation:
Mace Windu.

	Mace Windu is one of the only Jedi Knights to have a purple lightsaber.  Ki Adi Mundi has a blue lightsaber and Kit Fisto has a green lightsaber.  The blue and green lightsabers are the two most common Jedi lightsaber colors.  Plo Koon's lightsaber is also unique, because it is a yellow/orange lightsaber.  A red lightsaber denotes Sith, or evil.

questions.text: This television show starred Anthony LaPaglia and Poppy Montgomery.  It took place in New York City, and centered around an FBI missing persons unit.  What show is this?
questions.explanation:
Without a Trace.

	"Without a Trace" is a television show that ran from 2002 to 2009.  It spanned seven seasons and had 160 episodes.  "Without a Trace" took place within the "CSI Universe", and there was even a crossover between "Without a Trace" and "CSI: Crime Scene Investigation".

questions.text: Which of these is a Christian hymn published in 1779 and written by John Newton?
questions.explanation:
Amazing Grace.

	"Amazing Grace" was first published in 1779.  Since then, the song has become one of the most recognizable songs in English speaking lands.  It is often sung after a terrorist attack or a natural disaster.  Many famous musical artists have covered the song, using their own style.

Arsenic and Old Lace.

	Joseph Kesselring wrote "Arsenic and Old Lace" in 1939.  It became much more widely known when a film adaptation was created starring Cary Grant.  It was the most successful of Kesserling's 12 plays, playing 1,444 shows from 1941 to its close in 1944.

questions.text: Al Pacino starred as Tony Montana in a gangster movie that was based off a movie of the same name that was released in the '30s.  What movie was this?
questions.explanation:
Scarface.

	Al Pacino played Tony Montana in the gangster movie "Scarface" (1983).  It was based off of the movie of the same name that was released in 1932.  "Scarface" (1983) was directed by Brian de Palma.

questions.text: This 2008 film was based off of a Japanese anime of the same name from the '60s.  The movie is centered on cars.  What movie is this?
questions.explanation:
Speed Racer.

	"Speed Racer" was a popular Japanese anime during the 1960s, and plans for development of the movie began in 1992.  However, due to trading directors, making it more family-oriented, and the actual filming, it was not released until 2008!

questions.text: This television show focused on a Philadelphia police department.  The show starred Kathryn Morris.  What criminology-type show was this?
questions.explanation:
Cold Case.

	"Cold Case" was a police drama that ran from 2003 to 2010.  It took place in a Philadelphia police department that investigated cold cases, thus the title of the show.  Kathryn Morris played the main character, senior detective Lilly Rush. Just as a side note; "Cold Case" does not actually have the theme word "ace" in it; but instead it has a homophone, "ase".  Sorry for the confusion!  :-)

questions.text: This entertainer and pianist was the highest paid entertainer in the world during the 1950s-70s.  He was known by many names, including Walter Busterkeys, but by what name was he best-known?
questions.explanation:
Liberace.

	Liberace (lib-er-AH-chee) was born as Wladziu Valentino Liberace in 1919.  He passed away in 1987.  He was one of the most famous entertainers of all time, and was a very accomplished pianist.  During the '50s through '70s he was the highest paid entertainer in the world.

questions.text: A very famous phrase in the science fiction world is "Danger, Will Robinson".  From what sci/fi show does this quote come?
questions.explanation:
Lost in Space.

	"Lost in Space" ran for three seasons from 1965-1968.  It had 82 episodes in that time span.  Will Robinson was a well-known character from the show, and he was only a boy.  A movie of the same name was made in 1998, and it was based of the television series.

questions.text: Which of these actresses played D.J. Tanner on "Full House"?
questions.explanation:
Candace Cameron.

	Candace Cameron played the eldest of single father Danny Tanner's three children, Donna Jo, more commonly referred to as "D.J."  Jodie Sweetin played the middle child, Stephanie, and Mary-Kate, along with her twin sister, Ashley, Olson, played the youngest of the three sisters, Michelle.  Lori Loughlin played the part of Becky Donaldson.  "Full House" ran for eight seasons, with 192 episodes, from 1987-1995.
